critique: This document pertains to the Central Intelligence Agency Retirement and Disability System, specifically addressing the definition of "dependent" children for benefits eligibility. It eliminates the "living with" requirement for recognized natural children and adds a dependency requirement, defining "dependent" as either living with or contributing to the support of the child. This seems to be about aligning the CIA's system with amendments to the Civil Service Retirement and Disability System. There's no immediately obvious ideological tilt, immigration stance, or impact on executive power or federalism. It touches on social inclusion by broadening the definition of eligible children, but it's a minor adjustment. It doesn't directly regulate the economy or prioritize national security over civil liberties.
